original.context: Ralph Franklin Hefferline (15 February 1910 in Muncie, Indiana – 16 March 1974) was a psychology professor at Columbia University. Columbia University (Columbia; officially Columbia University in the City of New York), established in 1754, is a private Ivy League research university in Upper Manhattan, New York City, often cited as one of the world's most prestigious universities.
original.question: Ralph Hefferline was a psychology professor at a university that is located in what city?
original.primary_question: a university that is located in what city

contexts: Ralph Franklin Hefferline (15 February 1910 in Muncie, Indiana – 16 March 1974) was a psychology professor at Columbia University.

Columbia University (Columbia; officially Columbia University in the City of New York), established in 1754, is a private Ivy League research university in Upper Manhattan, New York City, often cited as one of the world's most prestigious universities.
adv_sent.distractor: The University of Utah (U of U, or simply The U) is a public research university in Salt Lake City, Utah.
adv_sent.distractor1: The University of Missouri–Kansas City (UMKC) is a public research university in Kansas City, Missouri.
